quiz.question: The English word 'whale' traces back to Old English 'hwæl'; which animal is that?
The Old English word 'wyrd' evolved into modern 'weird'; what did 'wyrd' originally mean?
Which English word derives from Latin 'liber' and names institutions for books?
Who in Greek literature became the model for the English word 'mentor'?
Which modern verb is a back-formation from 'editor'?
What is the linguistic term for forming a word by removing an affix, like 'edit' from 'editor'?
What does the word 'honeymoon' originally describe in marriage traditions?
options: A period of sweetness after marriage
quiz.answer: A period of sweetness after marriage

quiz.question: Which English pair demonstrates Norman French influence on meat vocabulary versus animals?
Which Old Norse-derived suffix '-by' in English place names denotes what?
Which plant name comes into English from Latin 'aloe' via Arabic mediation?
Which Romance language contributed most heavily to English legal vocabulary historically?
What term describes Latin-derived church vocabulary entering Old English after Christianization?
The English word 'salary' originally referred to payment linked to which commodity?
Which Old English lexical item narrowed in meaning to produce modern 'meat'?
Which Proto-Indo-European root is reconstructed as the origin of Latin 'pater' and English 'father'?
